data.title: Great group dinner
data.text: A ladies group that I belong to decided to give this new Indian restaurant in town a try.  We asked for and got a large private table area.  Our waitress was key in explaining the menu to us as well as the owner.  Without their tips the experience would not have been as good.  We ordered various items and ended up sharing.  Key is to order some of the bread to go with the meals.  3 different dipping sauces came with our appetizer or bread.  Can't remember which.  But all were good.  Foods can be ordered in different spiciness levels.  All dishes were something different for this area and good. Liquor also served here.  Pricing may be midrange but portions are large and can be shared or taken home.  Will be back.

data.title: Awesome Indian Food
data.text: This place has really great food at a reasonable price. One of the best restaurants in the area for sure.

data.title: Yummy Indian food
data.text: We have eaten here a few times.  It has been good every time.  There are a variety of good dishes to try.  For lunch they there is a buffet.  There is a range of spice levels. 2 is mild and 3 has a good kick.  Very tasty and great service.

data.title: Exceptional flavors!  My favorite restaurant!
data.text: Tandoor blew us away with their delicious flavors!  The owner waited on us and treated us like family, he was so nice.  We shared the Tandoori mixed grill and the Lamb Chops Masala, both dishes complemented each other perfectly and it was such a nice meal in every way.  Most significantly, the tastes and flavors in this restaurant blow you away.  They are unlike anything around here, and guaranteed delicious.  I hear that the lunch buffet is excellent as well.  Definitely, have the mango ice cream for desert!!  Thanks you so much Tandoor!!!

data.title: Authentic Indian Restaurant
data.text:
Out of nowhere in Decatur I found an Indian restaurant which uses fresh chicken and serves awesome food. The hotness rating is from 1-6. Beware, 3 was ok for us and 5 was good for us and we eat a spicy food.
Ambience was good, service was quick and good. 
Chicken chili - OMG was so flavorful so was chicken 65.

data.title: Great New Restaurant!
data.text:
As soon as we entered Tandoor we were impressed by their remodeling.  It's a very fresh contemporary look with nicely defined spaces throughout the room.  We were quickly greeted and seated and began our review of the menu.

Wow...there are a lot of tempting choices here and we had trouble deciding on anything.  Finally, we decide the Tandoori mixed grill would be a good start, paired with garlic naan.

The mixed grill includes: Tandoori Chicken,Shish Kabab, Malai Kabab, Boti Kabab, Chicken Tikka,and Tandoori Shrimp.  It comes with a very generous portion of white rice.  Everything was excellent and our favorites are the Tandoori Chicken and the Chicken Tikka.  And the garlic naan was great!  We had no leftovers!

Erica gave us great service, the atmosphere is great, prices are reasonable and the food is excellent.  We'll definitely be coming back!

data.title: Authentic Indian Cuisine
data.text: I'm from England, and in England we have a LOT of Indian food. I'm more than happy in saying that Tandoor is 100% authentic Indian food - so if you're looking to try a good, authentic curry, look no further! (and if you haven't tried curry before, give it a fair chance and definitely try it here!). Service was good and attentive, and the food was good enough that I visited twice in the three weeks I was in the States. I'll definitely visit again when I'm back at Christmas. The only criticism I could make is that the restaurant is too quiet - play some music or something, please!

data.title: Good food, fun place!
data.text: First time here to this new restaurant in town, and it was really good. The service was great, and Shawna took good care of us. I had Tandoori chicken, several at our table had chicken tikka, and some ordered stews. All the dishes were good. The naan was a big hit, and we watched them cook it in the Tandoor oven (they have a window that allows you to look into the kitchen where they throw the naan against the hot clay). They have several options for naan, including a garlic flavor. For dessert we tried two things - homemade mango ice cream and rice pudding. The only glitch in the evening was when 2 of our 8 dishes came out much ahead of the other 6 meals. We mentioned it to the manager and he said they are still working on getting all the dishes to come out at the same time, and I trust that will happen. They were very attentive and wanted to know our opinions of how things were. We will definitely be back.

data.title: Great buffet
data.text:
We came to town from the St. Louis area to celebrate my mother and sister's birthday.  They wanted to try out the new Indian restaurant.   Lunch was a buffet,  a good selection and everything was labeled.  It's my understanding that dinner is off the menu, not a buffet. 

The food was good, the restaurant was clean and the staff very attentive. 

We would definitely recommend Tandoor and look forward to eating there again when we are in town.

owner_response.author: Vinai N, Owner at Tandoor, The Indian Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank You.....Visit again when you are in town and try the al carte.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Below average indian food
data.text: I visited this place yesterday with my manager, I am on a business tour from houston.The Naan was hard and tandoori chicken didn't smell or taste like tandoori.it seems like fried in oil.When I asked about that to the waitress.One guy came and told that they are short in staff.Then I believe it's the owner, he came and started arguing with me on how tandoori chicken is made.i lived all my life in India and I know how tandoori tastes.i kept silent only because I was with my manager.i would rather go to KFC or Popeyes because they server what they say.

owner_response.author: Vinai N, Owner at Tandoor, The Indian Grill, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We don't know whats the price range of Houston where you live. Here every Indian restaurant in around is priced more than our price. Its our unfortunate you didn't like Tandoor chicken. We didn't have any complaints on Tandoor items or taste of food till now. Ofcourse we have complaints on late service. Its also because we are getting more tandoor orders on Al carte. We do have only one Tandoor oven its not holding up with baking of naan and tandoor orders at a time.Thats why We are backing up orders till now. The guy who spoke with you is the Manager. As per my understanding he didn't argued with you. you told him you didn't like the tandoor chicken. Then he explained that its the first complaint regarding the Tandoor order and  how many tandoor orders we are getting every day and he told you he  will look after where went wrong. If you really feel by telling you this he argued with you we are really SORRY ,ACCEPT OUR APOLOGIES. We created the see through concept kitchen of Tandoor . Its near buffet counter. Our customers enjoying the making of tandoor chicken and bread baking by seeing it through the window. We got the second Tandoor oven installed to day for faster service. We have to do some seasoning to day so from tomorrow we are baking bread on the oven which have see through concept and the tandoor orders with new Oven
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: o would have thunk that you could get great Indian food in Decatur, Illinois? We had a fabulous dinner! Great vegan, vegetarian, meat, and something for everyone. The ranch sauce with the papadums was strange to see, but people said it was delicious. They gave choices for spice levels, and stayed true to the selections. I do wish that there were some seeds for after the meal to clear my breath. Also, maybe because it just opened, but the staff were almost too polite and solicitous, but it was ok! Awesome meal. Go visit!
